i1.name: Void Shift
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Malzahar''' receives ''Void Shift'' if he hasn't taken non-{{tip|minion}} damage nor been affected by {{tip|crowd control}} in the last {{passive progression/deprecated version|4|30|24|18|12|1|6|11|16}} seconds.

''Void Shift'' phases out '''Malzahar''', making him {{tip|Cc-immune|immune to crowd control}} and causing him to take 90% reduced damage, lingering for {{fd|0.25}} seconds after taking damage or blocking a {{tip|crowd control}} effect.
i1.notes:
* ''Void Shift'' will not resist allied {{tip|crowd control}} nor will it be deactivated by them.
* '''Malzahar''' receives ''Void Shift'' upon respawning.
* ''Void Shift'' will not mitigate {{tip|true damage}} but the buff will still be consumed.
** It does not deactivate against the {{tip|Nexus Obelisk}}.
* {{tip|Shield|Shields}} will take priority over ''Void Shift'', but the buff will still be consumed (does not reduce damage inflicted). ''Void Shift'' triggers even if the shield negated the damage entirely.
** However, if '''Malzahar''' has a {{tip|spell shield}} and the {{tip|shield}} fully mitigates the damage, ''Void Shift'' does not trigger.{{bug}} The damage taken must be from an effect that cannot be negated by ''spell shields''.
* {{tip|Spell shield|Spell shields}} take priority over ''Void Shift''. If the triggering hostile ability does not contain a {{tip|crowd control}} effect, both ''Void Shift'' and the ''spell shield'' break simultaneously.
** Since ''spell shields'' are precedent over ''Void Shift'', applied {{tip|crowd control}} from effects that cannot be blocked by ''spell shields'' (i.e. {{ai|Wall of Pain|Karthus}}) will also ignore ''Void Shift'' despite its {{tip|cc-immune|crowd control immunity}}. The effect must not damage '''Malzahar''' for this event to take place.
* ''Void Shift'' will specifically not deactivate if '''Malzahar''' eats {{ui|Honeyfruit}} or is within a hostile {{ii|Frozen Heart}} passive [[aura]].

q1.name: Call of the Void
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Malzahar''' opens two portals that are each 200 units {{tt|perpendicular|Relative to Malzahar's position}} from the target location, granting a small area of {{tip|sight}} around them. After a {{fd|0.4}}-second delay, all enemies between the portals take {{as|magic damage}} and are {{tip|silence|silenced}} for a duration.

w1.name: Void Swarm
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Malzahar''' gains a stack of ''Zz'Rot Swarm'' when he casts another [[champion ability|ability]], up to a maximum of 2.

{{sbc|Active:}} '''Malzahar''' consumes all ''Zz'Rot Swarm'' stacks and, after a {{fd|0.5}}-second delay, summons a {{ui|Voidling}} at the target location. Additional ''Voidlings'' are then summoned for each ''Zz'Rot Swarm'' stack consumed.

''Voidlings'' deal {{as|magic damage}} with their attacks. ''Voidlings'' deal 50% damage to epic [[monster]]s, and 300% damage against enemy {{tip|minions}} affected by {{ai|Malefic Visions|Malzahar}}.
w1.notes:
* '''Malzahar''' loses all [[stack]]s upon [[death]].
* ''Zz'Rot Swarm'' stacks are gained per cast and not per ability activation. For example, if {{ai|Malefic Visions|Malzahar}} is cast and the ability cancels under certain circumstances, a ''Zz'Rot Swarm'' stack will still be granted despite the ability's failure to complete.

e1.name: Malefic Visions
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Malzahar''' infects the target enemy's mind, dealing them {{as|magic damage}} every half second over 4 seconds. Damaging a target with {{ai|Call of the Void|Malzahar}} or {{ai|Nether Grasp|Malzahar}} will refresh the duration of ''Malefic Visions''.
If the target dies during this time, they pass ''Malefic Visions'' onto the closest enemy, refreshing the duration and restoring {{sti|mana|{{as|2% of '''Malzahar's''' '''maximum''' mana}}}}.
e1.notes: * If the target becomes {{tip|untargetable}}, dies, or '''Malzahar''' loses {{tip|sight}} of them during the cast time, ''Malefic Vision'' cancels but its {{sti|cooldown}} and {{sti|{{as|mana}}}} are refunded.

  • Magic Damage Per Half Second: (+ 10% AP)

r1.name: Nether Grasp
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Malzahar''' forms a {{tip|tether}} between him and the target enemy {{tip|champion}}, {{tip|knockdown|knocking them down}}. '''Malzahar''' then {{tip|channel|channels}} for {{fd|2.5}} seconds, {{tip|suppression|suppressing}} and {{tip|sight|revealing}} the target and dealing them {{as|magic damage}} every {{fd|0.25}} seconds.
'''''Malzahar''' will continue to channel so long as the tether is not broken, even if the suppression is removed.''
A ''Null Zone'' is opened beneath the target that lasts 5 seconds, dealing {{as|magic damage}} every {{fd|0.5}} seconds to all enemies within.
''Null Zone will persist even if the ability is {{tt|interrupted|e.g. by Malzahar or crowd control effects}}.''
r1.notes:
* Applies {{tip|persistent damage}} for the [[tether]] and {{tip|persistent area damage}} to enemies within the ''Null Zone''.
* The tether will not break if the target enters a {{tip|zombie state}}.
* ''Nether Grasp'' and ''Null Zone'' count as two different abilities for effects such as {{ri|Electrocute}}.
* '''Malzahar''' places himself onto the ground and interrupts {{tip|airborne|displacements}} affecting him upon starting the channel.
* The following table refers for interactions while '''Malzahar''' is {{tip|channel|channeling}}:
{{ct|channel|attack=Disabled if attacking Nether Grasp target. Otherwise interrupts after {{fd|0.5}} seconds of channeling.|cast=interrupts|move=Interrupts only after {{fd|0.5}} seconds of channeling.|consume=true|items=interrupts,true,interrupts,false,interrupts|spells=true,interrupts,interrupts,interrupts}}
